Privacy Policy

This Privacy Policy outlines how SphereVRF handles data when you use our services. As a demonstration platform for verifiable randomness, our focus is transparency and minimal data collection.

1. Data Collection

We only collect the data you directly submit to the platform — this includes:

  • VRF requests (input ranges, optional identifiers)
  • Verification data (proofs, keys, inputs)

No personal information is requested, required, or stored.

2. Cookies & Tracking

We do not use cookies, third-party trackers, or analytics tools. Your visit is not monitored or profiled in any way.

3. Data Storage

Submitted requests may be temporarily logged for performance monitoring and debugging, but no long-term storage of identifiable data occurs. Logs are purged regularly.

4. Third Parties

We do not sell, share, or disclose any data to third parties. All computations are handled locally by our backend infrastructure without external API calls.

5. Security

All communications between your browser and our backend services are encrypted via HTTPS. Internally, cryptographic operations follow the ECVRF standard for integrity and verification.

6. Your Rights

Since we don’t store personal data, there’s nothing for you to request, delete, or correct. But if you have concerns, feel free to reach out.

7. Changes

This policy may evolve as the platform matures. Significant changes will be highlighted on this page.

Last updated: May 2025
